channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leaf Detritus, 7th January
item.description:
This was reported as not being swept since early November as these leaves have been on the pavement for weeks. Received report fixed? Same leaves are still there. Street needs proper cleaning. (Beckenham Grove)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Grove, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sofas dumped. Now people adding to pile, 7th January
item.description:
Hello someone dumped a sofa before christmas - three weeks, it is now being added to and is a health hazard as well as attracting other fly tipping to the pile - extra chairs etc. It is increasingly hard to pass and is causing a blockage. Thank you!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenwood Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned shopping cart near bus station on the street, 7th January
item.description:
Someone abandoned a few days ago a shopping cart on the street near bus station L Please remove it. Thanks a lot.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Widmore Road, Plaistow, Greater London

item.title: Rats are living in a car which is covered with a black sheet m, 7th January
item.description:
RATS not good where children are playing in the car park on there bikes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Johns Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London

item.title: SAFETY: Treacherous Ice on Footpath, 7th January
item.description:
A section of footpath over the Creek Traffic Bridge is very dangerous for pedestrians. This section has NOT been salted, and is particularly slippery. Three families that I spoke to this morning had all slipped / fallen-over on this section of pavement whilst taking their children to school. My son also fell over and landed badly. The affected section is the pavement on Creek Road, descending towards Norway Street, i.e. on the North-East section of the traffic Bridge (see photos) The only safe route was to walk in the Bicycle Lane, which appears to have been salted. Make no mistake - this section of footpath is treacherous ! Please add to the Highways "Salting Schedule" as a specific "slip / accident" risk to ensure this section receives salt-treatment going-forwards - thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Creek Road, Deptford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ice on Road and pavement on school road, 7th January
item.description:
We are a school road and the Ice on the pavement and on the road is causing issues this morning. We have also had some falls on the way into school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dollis Park, Church End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Icy pavements, 7th January
item.description:
Disappointed to see that Bexley Council have not bothered to grit the pavements of Welling High Street. Very icy this morning with several people, including myself, slipping on the ice. I can understand that side roads would not be gritted but would have thought that the main road and high street would have been made safe
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 124, Welling High Street, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Icy Roads Cycle Superhighway, 7th January
item.description:
The cycle super highway has had no de-icing at all (in Hackney and throughout the city)… such a very busy and popular route. Saw many accidents, including myself! Can we start adding these routes to the roster of salting when we have icy conditions?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cressington Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely icy, 7th January
item.description:
Mainridge, Walkden and surrounding roads on the incline need gritting they are extremely icy and dangerous. I slipped this morning and on Saturday a driver lost control and careered into my car parked outside my house.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Mainridge Road, Coldharbour, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned hire bikes Lime bike and Forest bikes., 7th January
item.description:
Abandoned hire bikes Lime bike and Forest bikes. The Hire bike at 166 Piccadilly parked overcrowded and Dangerously might hurt someone. Most of the bikes have park on the crossing of the road clearly obstruction and Hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Piccadilly, Mayfair, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chute blocked, 7th January
item.description:
Block 33-55 Llanover road. The upstairs community chute is blocked, something is in it, that prevents it from opening to use it to dispose of our rubbish.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Llanover Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Before garage， block carriage lane，next to 9 sedgemere road, 7th January
item.description:
The rubbish came yesterday night time， someone drop all rubbish on the lane which before garage. They dropped all cupboards and furniture. Please investigate it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sedgemere Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is flooding corner Oxford St and Orchard St by traffic lights, 7th January
item.description:
The road camber is wrong, causing a lake every time it rains. It is located outside Selfridges on the corner of Orchard and Oxford streets, where crowds of pedestrians wait by the traffic lights to cross over Orchard Street. This has been reported many times to WCC but was never fixed. It has also been reported to TfL but is not fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 451, Oxford Street, Mayfair, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged road surface, 7th January
item.description:
The road surface outside 102 is cracking up and sinking down, The gas company done some repairs some time ago and ever since there has been issues this road needs urgent attention please inspect and also check the curbs as there is alot of damage there also.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 123, Days Lane, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London

item.title: Faulty street light for steps, 7th January
item.description:
This street light has not been working for many weeks. It is essential for safe walking and personal safety from assaults up and down the steps leading to Maze Hill in the dark.

item.title: Huge Rubbish Pile, 7th January
item.description:
There is a huge pile of black bin bags, boxes, materials etc...stacked up in this small alleyway that really needs collection or cleaning up. I'm guessing this is from the Xmas period but it is very large now, includes a bed mattress flytip.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ice on the road and pavement, 7th January
item.description:
Iron Mill Lane leads to three schools, can I request a gritter attend this road asap as we had two vehicle incidents with parents/staff on their way to school, a student slipped on his bike and two students slipped on the pavement causing injuries. I am surprised that roads surrounding schools are not a priority. Would someone be able to help please, many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Iron Mill Lane, Barnes Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
